intro: Isomeris angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf isomeris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, narrow leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Isomeris angustata is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in disturbed or sandy habitats.
